This was a dangerous, showy, unapproved procedure. The screwdriver slipped. In a flash of blue light, the plutonium core released an intense burst of neutron and gamma radiation before Slotin managed to flick the top hemisphere off onto the floor. A half-second’s exposure was sufficient to give Slotin a lethal dose of radiation poisoning.
